Additional competencies include business planning and development, employee relations, recruitment, employee training, motivating and productivity, establishing and managing office operations, policy development, strategic planning, and vendor relations.

I am competent in Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel, proficiency in using computing systems. Experience Program Manager/Service Delivery Operations Manager Novitex Enterprise Solutions @ Cisco Systems October 2013  –  March 2015  (1 year 6 months) Remote Worker I am currently a Program Manager for the Lobby Ambassador program at Cisco Systems that is across all of US and Canada. I recently oversaw four different programs for Cisco's WPR (Work Place Resource) and employee services for Cisco’s San Jose Campus, outside of California locations, along with some Canada sites. I have strong leadership, management, and organizational skills. Practice safety compliance, competent in planning, forecasting, and budgeting. I am goal oriented and I like to keep my staff in tune with their individual goals as well as program goals, to showcase enhancements for each program. 
•	Trained coached and mentored staff to ensure smooth adoption of new programs. 
•	Partnered successfully with Vendors on campus at Cisco to produce accurate and efficient services. 
•	Strengthened Company’s business by leading and implementing new improved processes. 
•	Approved all time-cards for employees. Processed biweekly payroll to payroll company and ensured 100% accuracy in recording employees’ hours.  
•	HRMS maintaining updates for the team. Customer Operations Manager Pitney Bowes Management Services @ Cisco Systems December 2011  –  October 2013  (1 year 11 months) Milpitas I oversaw four different service programs for Cisco's WPR (Work Place Resource) employee services.  I have strong leadership, management, and organizational skills.  Practice safety compliance and competent in planning.  I am goal oriented and I like to keep my staff in tune with their individual goals as well as program goals, to showcase great development and enhanced programs.  I am competent in Microsoft Outlook, Word and Excel, proficiency in using computing systems.  
 
-Trained, coached and mentored staff to ensure smooth adoption of new programs.

Alternative Transportation Program Manager onsite at Cisco Systems Manpower November 2009  –  December 2011  (2 years 2 months) Milpitas Responsible for the Alternative Transportation program at Cisco Systems.  Rolled out new schedule and optimized the program to better service Cisco Employees.   
 
-Implemented innovative programs to increase employee loyalty and reduce turnover. 
-Optimized Shuttle Program – strategic planning involved, 
-Maintained and improved client satisfaction while managing customer relationships & exceeded customer expectations. 
-Responsible for Account and Staff Management, dispatch and Vendors on site. ·          
-Oversaw transportation operations, schedules, routes, equipment, drivers and client. Sr Account Sales Manager Serendipity Land Yachts @ Cisco Systems November 2007  –  December 2009  (2 years 2 months) Milpitas Held a role in providing business planning and development, employee relations, recruitment, employee training, motivating and productivity, establishing and managing office operations, policy development, strategic planning, and vendor relations.  
 
I increased efficiency and savings for the company’s revenue. With strategic problem-solver with smart solutions and executed across all levels of the organization, which included management bookkeeping. Assisted in creating enhanced and streamlined processes, as well as to achieve higher monthly ratings which impacted company’s overall success; this involved adherence to service level agreements, which included longevity with customers and monthly score rating 
As Sr. Account Manager I ensured the delivery of top notch services to Cisco. I held meetings and led the team to achieve key objectives. I served as a communication liaison between Serendipity and Cisco in development, forecasting, budgeting and providing metrics; which built a solid relationship with the customers.  
•	Ability to multi task , communicate effectively and demonstrate strong organizational skills 
•	Managed wide variety of customer service and administrative tasks to resolve customer issues quickly and efficiently. 
•	Ability to work with all levels of employees and management 
•	Provided effective communication and customer service support to the sales, marketing and administration teams on a daily basis. 
•	Handled daily heavy flow of paperwork and cooperated with the accounting department on invoicing. 
•	Promptly responded to general inquiries from clients via mail, email and fax. 
•	Created detailed analysis of services and presented to clients on a monthly basis. Licensed Real Estate Assistant Century 21 Tri Dam Realty April 2002  –  November 2007  (5 years 8 months) Managed all aspects of office operations; performed accounting, human resources, vendor relations, customer relations, payroll, accounts payable; duties involved receipt, review and processing of invoices; and monthly quarterly reports. I resolved any vendor discrepancies in a timely manner. I also worked under fast pace and demanding deadlines, per each contract. Along with I was promoted to support company and Agent in an all aspects of the business with hard work ethic, business savvy as well as trustworthiness and accountability. Provided leadership, guidance and execution support for corporate marketing communications initiative. 
•	Organized and maintained records for processing escrows, scheduling inspections. 
•	Prepared all aspects of communication to other agents, sellers, lenders, title companies and future buyers and seller. 
•	Maintained a variety of documents for each transaction including any listing.  
•	Kept a calendar for all contract deadlines and provide full range of administrative support, including phone lines, copying, faxing, supplies and equipment maintenance. 
•	Excellent personal interaction with clients and good communication/working relationship with other departments/vendors. 
•	Interacted with all levels to maximize and increase revenue quarterly.

Summary Career Summary 
 
Program manager with a 13 year record of successful launching, directing and managing of small and large scale programs by performing management functions such as, planning, scheduling, organizing, tracking processes, reporting and budget management ensuring the success of each project and customer satisfaction. 
 
Key Skills and Strengths: 
•	Capable of leading complex global programs and projects under tough deadlines, to meet expectations of multiple customers 
•	Strong written and oral communications. 
•	Organizational ability and multi-tasking skills. 
•	Service orientation – “People person” and a team player.

 Experience HR Diversity Program Manager Microsoft (via Derflan Inc.) February 2014  – Present (1 year 7 months) Redwood City, CA Key Initiatives and Achievements: 
•	Program Manager for Diversity and Inclusion programs within the Microsoft Services organization. 
•	Collaborate with HR Managers and Services Senior Leadership to deliver assigned programs – Develop group and individual timelines, assess/identify potential bottlenecks in each project/program process. 
•	Participate in strategic design and planning of future Mentoring programs including Senior Women’s Rings as well as Women’s Technical Rings. 
•	Conduct retention interviews for senior technical women within the Services Organization 
•	Oversight of systems and process changes to support and improve business. 
•	Develop, implement and manage the program communications for both participants and senior leadership.  
•	Develop a metric process for tracking all program participants throughout the life of the program. Data is used to show 
Mentee performance trends and validate ROI of the program. 
 Learning & Development Program Manager TEKsystems, onsite at Cisco Systems, INC September 2012  –  February 2014  (1 year 6 months) Raleigh-Durham, North Carolina Area •	Responsible for managing multiple global deliveries of competency and role based trainings. Both Instructor Led (ILT) and Virtual. 
•	Worked with theatre stakeholders to gather all training requirements including but not limited to: 
-	Delivery Schedule 
-	Learning Management System criteria 
-	All training coordination support needed 
•	Developed and maintained the Sales Enterprise Fiscal Year Training Map which includes the training forecast and delivery schedule per theatre. 
•	Facilitated weekly project meetings with stakeholders to review training forecast, schedule, and reporting.  
•	Coordinated with training coordinators for assembling and reporting training data and metrics as required and maintenance of the WIKI sites. 
•	Built and maintained vendor relationship with all instructors. 
 
 Learning and Development Business Operations Program Manager Microsoft May 2008  –  September 2012  (4 years 5 months) Greater Seattle Area Responsibilities include Operations\Business and Project Management within the Microsoft Advertising and Online Global Readiness Team. 
•	Established the business rhythm for a newly created global training team including but not limited to: 
-	Budget management, creation of metrics scorecard, and led strategic meetings with management team and created systems to drive initiatives forward. 
-	Managed $7 million global budget for both the Readiness and Advertiser Satisfaction organization to goal each fiscal year. 
-	Developed, implemented and managed a Global Communication Strategy to include written communications for our key audiences and stakeholders. 
 
Project Manager: 
•	Accountable for end-to-end Project Management for projects of varying scope. 
-	Assessed requirements for resources (people, physical assets, and budget). This includes identifying resources outside of the business group\organization. 
-	Recognized risks at tactical levels by using an assessment of priorities and resource availability through a mitigation matrix. 
-	Anticipated problems and took the initiative to solve them outside the scope of own deliverables, and kept teams moving forward, which resulted in on-time delivery. 
-	Created a 4-stage Project Management Toolkit for the organization to ensure consistency, accuracy and increase organizational capability. 
-	Project lead for several global, executive sponsored programs including a complex yearly people management project sponsored by the Vice President of the Sales, Marketing and Services organization. 
 Learning and Development Program Mananger Microsoft December 2005  –  May 2008  (2 years 6 months) Redmond, WA Responsible for managing a 2-year new hire training program for all College new hires coming in to the Sales and Marketing organization. 
•	Worked with marketing leadership to create a robust new hire training program to accelerate the learning and development of all new college and MBA hires into Microsoft. 
•	Developed, implemented and managed the program communications for both participants and senior leadership.  
•	Provided logistical support for all event and training planning including use of an LMS and survey creation and analysis.  
•	Developed a metric process for tracking all new hire performance throughout the life of the program. Data was used to show participant performance trends and validate ROI of the program. 
•	Trained and coached managers on performance management for the college hire to increase new hire employee development and job satisfaction. 
•	Partnered with the College Recruiting team to help interview potential marketing college hires.  
•	Created and managed program Sharepoint site as both an information and collaboration portal. Recruiting Coordinator Microsoft Corporation May 2000  –  December 2005  (5 years 8 months) •	Significant event planning responsibilities that included managing on-campus interviews, company presentations, technology talks, PR events, and other school-based activities at fourteen top-tier competitive schools across the US and Canada, resulting in 159 fulltime and 127 intern hires. 
•	Built and leveraged strong working relationships with career center contacts, diversity organizations, student consultants and other university representatives to ensure a positive image for Microsoft and successful execution of strategic recruiting events. 
•	Scheduled interviews and phone screens working directly with candidates and hiring managers, in some cases arranging travel for visiting candidates. 
•	Updated candidate records and job postings in recruiting systems and confirming new hires. 
•	Provided follow-up correspondence to candidates on recruiting status via phone and email. 
•	Tracked recruiting activities and providing candidate status in a weekly report. 
•	Coordinated the post-interview debrief meetings and providing debrief materials. 
•	Identified opportunities for improving candidate experience and scheduling efficiency. 
•	Assisted the coordination of other recruiting activities as needed. Program Manager YMCA June 1992  –  June 1996  (4 years 1 month) •	Responsible for the development, administration, implementation and ongoing evaluation of all youth 
sports and community operations programs. 
•	Recruited, trained, and supervised required staff for the Sports Program department.

Davis Scholarship Fund was established by Mr. and Mrs. Brackett Clark. Summary Saima has over 25 years of versatile global experience in various areas from Accounting, Finance, Mergers & Acquisitions, Systems Development, and Enterprise Governance, Risk and Compliance. Her roles include Chief Executive Officer (CEO), Chief Technology Officer (CTO), Chief Operating Officer (COO), Program Director.  
 
Saima has managed projects from $50k to $100 million at Fortune 500 companies including Garmin, Fisker Automotive, Yamaha Motor Corporation, Sage Software, Live Nation Entertainment, TicketMaster, Juniper Networks, Silicon Graphics, Cisco Systems, Well Fargo, American Savings Bank, Federal Credit Unions, Eisai Pharmaceuticals, Teleflora.  
 
She has worked & negotiated with KPMG, EY, Deloitte & Touche, Deloitte Tomatsu in compliance capacities on behalf of her clients. She worked with pre-IPO’s, bond stage corporations, public and private organization. She is an active member of the IT Governance and Compliance (Securities, Operations, Change Management) ISACA, LA Chapter. 
 
Coupled with a solid Business, Governance & Compliance, Technology and Creative background, Saima demonstrates great foundation for her next endeavors. 
 
Currently, Saima is working on a technology platform which includes the Wedding, Floral and the Automotive industry for service providers and customers.
